FuncDef: The display xpl interface-list command displays the configuration and reference information about XPL interface lists.
CLIs: display xpl interface-list state [ attached | unattached ]

ParaDef.Info:
Displays information about the interface lists that are referenced.
-

Displays information about the interface lists that are not referenced.
-

Specifies the name of the interface lists.
The value is a string of 1 to 200 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. The string can contain letters, digits, underscores (_), hyphens (-), and dots (.). It must start with a letter or digit.

Displays information about points of attachment.
-

Displays information about outbound interface list configurations and references.
-

Examples: Attached :Applied by at least one attach point
Unattached : Not applied by any attach point
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To view information about XPL route-filter and route attribute set configurations and references, run the display xpl command. If a large amount of information is output, you can specify attached or unattached to filter the information. Route attribute set reference indicates that a route attribute set is referenced by a route-filter, and route-filter reference indicates that a route-filter is referenced by a routing protocol. To check the configuration and reference information about XPL interface lists, run the display xpl interface-list command.
